item.title: Projects
item.description: Here’s a short excerpt from my past and current (public) projects: SR6 Character Sheet: when our gaming group switched to online play during the COVID-19 pandemic, I built a digital character sheet for Shadowrun 6 Keedrop: easily & securely send passwords. It doesn’t replace GPG, but at least you won’t have to send them in plaintext over chat or email. k290-fnkeyctl: when I got myself annoyed with the way that my Logitech keyboard handled its function keys, I reverse-engineered a small application to switch the behaviour on Linux.

item.title: About me
item.description: Born 1982, I spent my teenage years witnessing and exploring the rise of the internet. Since, I have been able to gather professional experience in a number of technologies: everything from network security and setting up Sendmail-based mail servers ðŸ“¨, doing computer games development in C++ and DirectX ðŸŽ®, via Java business software ðŸ’¼ up to web applications with Ruby On Rails ðŸ’Ž. Today I work at i22 Digitalagentur, assisting our customers in introducing new technology into their business.
